intro: Cynoglossum bakhtiaricum, commonly known as the Bakhtiar's tongue-shaped flower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Cynoglossum bakhtiaricum is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and habitat requirements.
